benchmark_details.name: PingPong: A Benchmark for Role-Playing Language Models with User Emulation and Multi-Model Evaluation
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a benchmark for evaluating the role-playing capabilities of language models by leveraging different language models to simulate users in dynamic, multi-turn conversations and assess the resulting dialogues.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust and dynamic evaluation framework for language models' role-playing capabilities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Sample size of 64 conversations per model may limit statistical robustness.

data.source: Conversations evaluated include character scenarios drawn from various media, designed for role-playing interactions.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by human evaluators with assessments on multiple criteria.

methodology.calculation: Spearman correlation used to compare model annotations with human evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect model performance in role-playing contexts based on conversational quality.
methodology.validation: Correlation with human annotations validated through manual evaluations.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Efforts made to include diverse character and situation designs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Only artificially generated conversations used, avoiding privacy concerns.
